      • passMessage

        private void passMessage(java.lang.String driverName,
               java.lang.String message)
        Pass a message to the driver specified by name.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the unique name of the driver
        message - the message to pass

      • readSerial

        private java.lang.Byte readSerial()
        Reads a single byte of data from the incoming serial connection
        Returns:
        the Byte value of the read byte, null if there was nothing to read or if the read failed.

      • serialDataAvailable

        private boolean serialDataAvailable()
        Checks the serial connection to see if there is any data available for reading
        Returns:
        true if data is available for reading, false otherwise

      • sendCommandAndWait

        public static java.lang.String sendCommandAndWait(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String command,
                                  int waitPeriod)
        Sends a message to a remote module and waits waitPeriod seconds for a response.
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the remote module
        command - the command to send to the remote module
        waitPeriod - how many seconds to wait for a response. Maximum period to wait is 6 seconds.
        Returns:
        the response string of the remote module or null if no response was found

      • sendCommand

        public static void sendCommand(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String command)
        Sends the given command to a specific remote module
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the remote module
        command - the command to send to the remote module

      • storeData

        public static int storeData(java.lang.String driverName,
            java.lang.String dataTag,
            java.lang.String data)
        Stores the given data to persistent storage. Data is tagged with both the driver name as well as a data tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the module
        dataTag - a tag to assign to this data. This tag should be specific for each data block that your driver stores. If there already exits data for the given tag the old data will be overwritten.
        data - the string of data to store
        Returns:
        -1 if data overwrote information from a previous tag. 1 if data was written successfully. 0 if the data could not be written.

      • readData

        public static java.lang.String readData(java.lang.String driverName,
                        java.lang.String dataTag)
        Returns data previously stored under the given module name and tag.
        Parameters:
        driverName - the name of the calling driver
        dataTag - the tag to uniquely identify the data
        Returns:
        the stored String data, or null if no data has been stored under the given driver name and tag.

      • isModulePresent

        public static boolean isModulePresent(java.lang.String moduleName)
        Checks the list of known remote modules. If the module is not present the Coordinator may re-query the remote modules for updates.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - the name of the remote module to check for
        Returns:
        true if the remote module is known to be up, false otherwise

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
